page.title: 01Rattlesden - General
page.content: This area is mainly agricultural with 21 farms. All are arable except for one pig farm. The village of{Rattlesden}lies in the centre of the area and comprises a church, chapel, two pubs, village hall, garage, school, post office and general store. There is a mixture of modern houses and old cottages, some fine restored houses - several thatched with original timbers and beams. There is a playing field and pavillion. The hamlets of Borley Green, Drinkstone Green and Poy St. Green are on the edges of this area. The river Rat runs from east to west in a valley passing through the village.
